Honeywell Pilot Gateway
New Website for Pilots Adds Additional Features Honeywell’s new website for pilots launched just a few months ago, but new features are already being added. Users can now access this newsletter, Direct-TO, along with other important updates and events. Read/unread indicators have also been added, along with flags for new and updated publications. Read More. <https://aerospace.honeywell.com/en/Pilots/Newsletters/2014/September%202014/Pilot%20Gateway>
The Radar Corner The RDR-4000 3D Volumetric Radar–The Beginning: Part 2 Last month’s article started looking at the early human factors study that helped define the RDR-4000 weather radar modes and functions. Some of the questions that Honeywell asked pilot’s during the study were discussed, and answers to the first four questions, which dealt with tilt management, were explained. This month’s article will look at the answers to the last four questions in the study. Read More. <https://aerospace.honeywell.com/en/Pilots/Newsletters/2014/September%202014/RDR-4000Pt2>

Global Data Center Update
Creating a Flight Package on MyGDC.com
Global Data Center subscribers have access to the MyGDC.com <http://www.mygdc.com/> website and app, which have a variety of flight planning tools and features, including the Flight Package feature. By creating a Flight Package, the pilot or dispatcher can schedule a flight plan and weather package to be automatically sent at a predetermined time in the future. Read More. <https://aerospace.honeywell.com/Pilots/Newsletters/2014/September%202014/GDC%20Flight%20Package>
Tools of the Trade
Sky Connect Tracker III: Powerful Mission Management Capabilities
When a serious problem occurs in flight, a long list of items must be completed in a short amount of time. Notifying dispatch that there is a problem, and transmitting aircraft position and other critical information comes second to handling the emergency. Read More. <https://aerospace.honeywell.com/Pilots/Newsletters/2014/September%202014/SkyConnect>
Events and Training Calendar 2014 Events and Training Honeywell's Flight Technical Services team travels extensively to bring pilots the latest information on regulations, new technology, and Honeywell product updates. Through Pilot Breakout Sessions at Honeywell Operators Conferences, one-on-one training, entry into service support, and live webinars, Honeywell pilots are on a mission to keep operators informed.
